wikipedia_page.main:
Andrew Freemantle (22 October 1768 at Bishops Sutton, Hampshire – 19 January 1837 at Easton, Hampshire) was an English cricketer who played for Hampshire during the Hambledon Era and afterwards.  He was a left-handed batsman, a noted fielder and an occasional wicket-keeper.
Freemantle made his known debut in the 1788 season and had 136 known appearances in major matches to the 1810 season. He played for the Players in the inaugural and second Gentlemen v Players matches in 1806.His brother John Freemantle was an earlier Hambledon player.

response: A number of players are first noted in first-class matches in 1788, amongst them the Hampshire professional Andrew Freemantle who played the first of his 134 first-class matches in a career which lasted until 1810.
John Freemantle was the elder brother of the more famous Andrew Freemantle.  He had only a short first-class career from the 1780 season until 1782, playing seven times for Hampshire.

George Freemantle (born 14 March 1806, Easton, Hampshire; details of death unknown) was an English cricketer who was associated with Hampshire and made his first-class debut in 1829. His father was Andrew Freemantle of the Hambledon Club.
|Played in seven first-class matches for Hampshire. Elder brother of Andrew Freemantle.
